Try their falafel, you'll not be disappointed, seasonings are perfect. If you have some room and a sweet tooth, the desserts are surprisingly delicious. Something here for everyone wanting Mediterranean fare. Nazik is always friendly and we look forward to seeing her after our drive from Boulder City.
Restaurant was clean, chicken gyros were flavorful, and service was decent. Waitress forgot to bring out humus  appetizer before entrees.
The lamb shank and the moussaka is awesome. I've been coming here for years. Top Greek place in Las Vegas/Henderson. Very underrated.
This place is amazing! The best tzadziki sauce I've ever had! Not to mention the authenticity of the flavors here. If you are looking for great Greek food, this place is a must! Yum!
Open kitchen layout. Authentic. Clean. Super family feel and friendly service. Offered me extra meat if I was still hungry!  Good ice tea refills. Very pleasing

Very good food. Beautiful presentation. Family-owned with pride and care. Clean visible kitchen area. Clean dining area and bathroom too. Only caution would be if mildly spicy red peppers are not your thing, just let them know to go easy when you order. They are very accommodating. The chicken soup and Greek salad could easily be a whole lunch meal or even dinner for a light eater. Although they don't prepare the pita dough, they do bake it on the premises. We were again very pleased with our experience. We try to eat here whenever we come to Vegas.

This place is awesome. Everytime I eat there the food is perfect. They are always polite, fast service, great food. The baklava is AWESOME! The gyro...perfect. This family place is becoming a regular spot for me. I highly recommended it.
I still love this place...I want to provide an update because the owner is always so friendly. She makes you feel like you are a guest at her home. I want to eat here every other day!

This would be a 5 star on the food but the phone system sucks. Waited 15 minutes on the phone to place a take out order for my BDay. I drove there still on hold....i had the waiter pick up the phone to answer my call on hold.

Ask for Raffi!
Excellent customer service and knowledge base coupled with impeccable manners. My gyro was perfect!
Thank you.

Best Greek food in town.  

The gyro is fantastical.  The gyro player is great for sharing.  

I have been 100's of times over the years and have never had a complaint.  It's amazing they are still open as the location is horrific.  Once Nelson's custard closed next door I thought for sure they would be next.  

I have told them they need to open up in the mall or in a casino location.  The food is way to good to see them fail.  Especially with places like mad Greek and that place at the mall Kylos Greek cafe (horrible).  

If you want a family friendly great Greek food give them a try you won't be disappointed.  Oh Greek fry's are awesome.
Amazing gyros and fries! Tried a few other Mediterranean. Places and this by far is the best!  Service is wonderful! It's worth the travel if your not close.

First time trying this restaurant after seeing all the positive reviews. Had the traditional gyro and it is DELICIOUS!! Meat is very tender and flavorful. Fries had a great seasoning. Will definitely come back again!

Absolutely love the traditional gyro here. Personal favorite in all Vegas! As a recovering carnivore, this place always tempts me into relapsing. Been coming for a couple years, never had a bad experience.
So delicious... The hummus and pita..omg the rice!!  Lemon potatoes and Filet.  All so tasty. And the owner( I assume) was very sweet too. Thanks well be back!!

under new ownership and food is still good.  Gyros are our favorites.  They have redecorated it and looks much better except the chairs need foam on the bottoms.  Their dolmades were good but a little bland - and I would have preferred to have Tzakaki with them instead of the sauce they provided.  Our only complaint is that the waiter had on so much after shave it left a smell around our table that didn't go with the good.  That affected our rating!  Its great for lunch!

Had a terrific gyro and fries - also comes with a super fresh and tasty greek side salad --  wow.  Seriously delicous.  Wonderfully fresh.  

Service started out with a bit of attitude considering the joint was empty -- and we were a little skeptical when he said the gyro was the best in town -- but ya know, I think it was.  I've not tried all of them  yet, but it's not a bad aspiration if I were in serious need of weight gain (which sadly, I'm not) so I'll have to consider it a treat and good to know about in that wasteland of nothingness food-wise...

If you're really in the mood to splurge, they have plenty of Greek dessert options, or you can get frozen custard at Neilson's next door who's stopped making sandwiches, probably because the Greek Bistro's are too good to compete with...  

ahhh summer....

Read a small review in the RJ and liked the idea of family owned and operated.  Decided to try there for dinner and as a bonus found a 15% off coupon on line.  Was not disappointed.  Falafel, gyro, chicken greek salad were all fresh and homemade. As was the humus and yogurt dip for the french fries.  Oh, and the seasoned fries were great too!!  Will definitely return.  Please try it and support the mom & pops in our area.

This is one of the closest restaurants to where I've called home for over 5 years, and I hadn't ever tried it. Today, I told myself "no more excuses."

Yes, I finally went to Greek Bistro. It's exactly what it says on the tin: a small Greek restaurant, hidden in a small strip mall behind Wildfire Casino and on the outer circle of the "ring" surrounding Sunset Station. I stopped in after 1:30 for a late lunch, finding a surprising number of tables occupied but with plenty open for myself. The blue-heavy decor is charming in its way, but I would probably not order dine-in here if I wasn't so concerned about eating freshly prepared food.

[Rambling personal story warning!] I wasn't always as ambitious with trying unfamiliar businesses as I am now, and none of my friends ever invited me to try this place back in my first few years around. I finally did invite someone to try it with me around Christmastime 2015, but they had closed early on that evening, so I pushed it to the back of my mind again. Lately, I've found myself more and more frequently bemoaning the lack of great food on my side of Henderson, so I finally had to address one of the biggest potential counterarguments.

The young man who greeted me was quick with asking for my order and surprisingly quicker coming back around after I asked for some time to think about my order. Truth be told, I was stalling to take menu photos, a challenge that became far easier after a woman who is presumably the owner offered me a to-go menu. This version didn't have the reflective plastic cover that their standard menu does, and prices were consistent. And the food was good, even great at times.

I had the traditional gyro sandwich ($8.99) with fries, and the gyro was certainly one of the better ones that I've had to try. Delicious tzatziki and fresh lettuce, tomato, and red onions adorned the beef and lamb slices, which were still the star of the dish. The pita was solid, not exceptional. I was disappointed by the lack of salt in the fries themselves, which can only be covered up so far by the seasoning or by extra salt, and the surprising slight dryness of the fries' interior. The tzatziki was a fun dip for the fries though, and I found myself using the tzatziki to pick up seasoning from the bottom of the tray. That aside, I would order the small salad instead of the fries.

Dessert was better. The baklava ($4.25) is a surprisingly huge square-shaped portion that's roughly 3 inches per side. I would not recommend taking it on alone, and I even ended up asking for a to-go box despite (or because of) how much I enjoyed it. When you break into the baklava, honey oozes out of the crispy fillo dough with a layer of crushed walnuts inside and a garnish of crushed pistachios on top. The flavor is somehow richer and more nuanced than other baklavas that I've had in the past. I was very wrong about this neighborhood not having good desserts, and I'll be sure to try their other sweets now that I know where to look.

I also ordered a moussaka ($13.95) to-go. I hadn't had this dish in ages, but I'd always fondly remembered the eggplant and ground beef layered dish that I'd tried years ago, and this brought me back. Loved the spices in the moussaka as well as the side salad of lettuce, cucumber, red onion, tomato, and feta. There's an additional side of seemingly the same sauce that bathes the moussaka, and I wasn't sure what to do with it except just enjoy it slowly with every bite of the moussaka. The portion is a bit more of a huge lunch or solid dinner, so you might consider sharing it. Moussaka, baklava, and maybe an appetizer? Sounds like a great meal for two right there.

Greek Bistro is an enjoyable restaurant that may indeed be the gem of this mostly chain-ridden side of town. I'll definitely explore their menu further, and I won't wait another 5 years to do so.
Great food and great service. This is one of our new favorite spots in Henderson. Not pricy and delicious food.

This is more of a personal emotional review. 

So I never really tried Greek food before. I had just came from kick boxing near by and I wanted to eat a healthy salad and my mom suggested this place. 

As soon as I walked in the scenery caught my eye. 
It was so beautiful. Blue and white and there large pictures of Greece. My Goodness I suddenly felt like there was apart of me that was missing all along. It really made me emotional. 

Being part Greek and not knowing the first thing about being Greek started to frustrate me. I didn't know what the sauces were or Falafel  it all looked so good and it was hard to choose. The lady who served us was beautiful and nice. She didn't speak much to us but she was very sweet. 

When our food arrived it looked amazing. Everything was fresh and perfect. The olives they put in the salad is so good. That homemade sauce was so BOMB!! I'll try that place at least once a week or once every two weeks. 

I was so urged to take pictures. 

Weird memory though it kind of smelled like old mop water but it was when I first walked in. It wasn't that bad.

Like others said, this is a great family owned business. The food was really good, and there is a lot of it! We started shared the greek salad which was a great appetizer for 2 people. I had the traditional gyro and my wife had the chicken gyro, both with fries. It was too much food for 2 people, neither of us finished all of the fries. We had a $25 restaurant.com certificate which stated we had to spend at least $37.50, which is why we ordered so much food. We ordered beer and wine also so we did hit the minimum we had to spend. At first the older female owner (the same in previous reviews) took the coupon and said it didn't apply to the beverages. But I showed her in the description that is doesn't state that, just that we had to spend $37.50. She went to the back and after a few minutes came back and said ok, but didn't seem too thrilled about it. She was still very nice though and seemed to appreciate our business. 

The traditional gyro is the best! My wife and I agreed that it was better than the chicken. And the pita bread is delicous. The greek salad was really good and so were the fries. If you're looking for a great gyro this place is a must. We will definitely go back in the future (and order less food).
Love this family owned bistro. Best Greek food in Vegas. Trust me when I say it won't disappoint.

We found this place on yelp after a long flight cross country. We couldn't have been happier to find the best Greek food we've had in a long time! We can't wait to come back! This place is legit!! You know when you find local elderly greek women eating here on a Saturday night that it's authentic! The staff and owner couldn't have been nicer! 5 Stars!!

This is my favorite Greek restaurant! My husband and I found this place over a year ago, and we've been coming here almost 3 times a month since. The owner is so nice, and we always feel welcomed. They already memorize our order. I love everything on the menu, but I mostly order the chicken kabob plate or the kaftedakia plate. They're both so good!
The Greek bistro is by far the best Greek restaurant in Las. Vegas, I have never had a bad meal always fresh

My first time but definitely not my last. I had the gyro sandwich and Greek fries. The sandwich had just the right combination of meat, onion, tomato, and sauce. I had never had Greek fries before. They were very good. For dessert I had the baklava which was twice as big and twice as good as any other place.

Very welcoming with homemade food. Much care is taken into the food and service in this place. The owners know most of their patrons but are friendly to newbies as well. You get the feeling that they are cooking for you in the same way they would if you visited their home. Will return!
The best Gyros and fries that I have eaten since I left Chicago.  Service is great and friendly.

This family Greek restaurant is pretty good.  I go for the traditional gyro with a salad.  I have had the seasoned fries and those taste really good as well.  I'm not a big Greek fan but I do crave gyro's and when I do, I always come here.  Price is a little bit higher than I like, I think it was around $9/$10 for the gyro with salad.  Check it out, enjoy!

Yum, chicken gyro "sandwich" with greek salad. I don't know what they put on that salad but it's so yummy, I'm not even tempted by the fries it's that good! Wonder if they'll do extra salad instead of the pita, will find out and if they do they're getting 5 stars! Chicken is delicious, not dry one bit, seasoning is on point! Decor could use a little help but that's about it.
WOW!  Got the gyro salad and it was amazing!! Nice little family owned restaurant.

The best gyros in town!!! The pita bread itself has a good flavor to it, unlike the generic pita breads out there...the chicken greek salad and the hummus are also good it makes you want to come back!!! Great staff and a great, clean place to eat...Highly Recommended!!!

Just what the Doctor ordered! Needed a new Greek spot since relocating to Henderson. Quite impressed! I'll definitely be back to this place. Chicken gyro was on point.. I couldn't decide on my side so o
I got both, and they both exceeded my expectations. The Greek fries..YUMMY! The salad, refreshing!

Yum! I'm an instant fan. Now I know of two awesome Greek restaurants near my house.

If you are dining in there are tables for sit down service. Take-out is either called in ahead ordered at the register in the back. We were doing take-out yesterday. 

Someone greeted us soon after coming in and asked if wanted to dine in or take-out. We grabbed a menu at the back counter, picked out our dishes, and ordered. Food pricing was reasonable and our food was ready to go in less than 10 minutes. It seemed like a friendly family run restaurant.

I ordered the Shrimp a la Greek. The sauce on the shrimp was good and I absolutely loved the bed of rice. The rice had almonds, spinach, fruit, and plenty of seasoning. It was one of the most addictive rices I've ever had. There was a nice amount of salad and the dressing was really good. The dressing was different than other Greek dressings I've had, but in a good way. The pita was really soft and nicely seasoned. I was definitely impressed with each part of this meal.

My husband had the Greek Plate which came with gyro meat, Greek potatoes, pita, and salad. He loved this meal. I sampled the Greek potatoes and thought they were well seasoned and delicious. We also had the Baklava, but that wasn't my favorite. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best I've had.

Greek Bistro is definitely one of my local favorites now. Yummy with great service.
Really good gyro! THe overall lunch had character with a more personal season.

I just happened to be hungry and at a store nearby.  I went in and waited while they prepared a carry out order and to be honest, I did not have high expectations.  I had never heard of this place.  When I got home, I wasn't impressed with their dolmades but I was blown away by their spanakopita.  It was the most unique kind I have ever had, not only with cheese and spinach, but delicious herbs and tomatoes.  Their salad was incredibly fresh and the dressing was delicious.  I'm definitely heading back.

The best Greek food in Las Vegas 
The owner is very nice
I love the place I could eat here every day

I went here a few years ago but a lot came in between, so I am just getting back to this restaurant. To my delight, the food is as luscious as ever. I grew up in a city that has a lot of excellent Greek restaurants (Boston, Mass.)  so I know good from great .This one is great. I am a vegetarian, so I had the falafel wrap with its generous salad and the baba ganoush. WOW! Taste sensation! I intend to try the egg lemon soup next time and if I remember from the past the Spanakopita is outstanding. Can't wait. (Just have to stagger my visits. I want to go back every day, lol.)

I love Greek food and can be quite picky about it. I was just in Greece last month and I must say the food here was even better than what I got in Athens! I got the traditional Gyro served with a Greek salad. My mom got the Moussaka. I love Moussaka as well so I took a taste of it. It was made perfectly and so delicious! My Gyro was awesome...it was very large and I ended up eating the entire thing. The salad was delicious as well. I will definitely visit again and I look forward to trying other items on the menu.

Greek bistro is an excellent authentic Greek experience. We had the traditional gyro sandwich, one with salad and one with fries. The meat was extremely tender and delicious (cut from the spit). The pita bread was also soft, doughy and delicious.  The tzatziki sauce on the gyros sandwich was creamy and amazing. I thought the sandwich could have used a few more onions but my wife thought it was perfect. The Greek side salad was awesome (not just an afterthought) and the fries were delicious. The staff was extremely nice. For dessert we ate the Baklava, it was warm flaky, cinnamony and sweet and was possibly the best Baklava I have ever eaten.  The Greek Bistro had a very authentic Greek family feel to it's ambiance and was really a joy to have a meal at. This is our new spot for authentic Greek food.  Highly recommend.

I yelped this place and was not disappointed. The food was excellent. We had the humus appetizer and it was delicious. Some in our group got the traditional gyro and said it was the best they had ever had. Everything was delicious and fresh.

Absolutely am never disappointed at any meal here.  One of my favorite places to eat out at; family owned and run with great food and though small, very friendly atmosphere. My family & I have been eating there since they opened & it has always been consistent with large helpings & everything cooked to perfection! Very clean & profesional, the gyro salad is so good & refreshing in this desert heat.

The food is good here but the owner or the lady that runs this place is abrasive and rude. She slammed my credit card on the counter and threw her order booklet down after she took my order and was not pleasant at all! So I asked her "are you ok today cause you're usually really nice?" And she yelled at me saying "what did I do? What did I say to you? I have a headache! I'm not doing anything to you!" So I sat down to wait for my order and she was still going on yelling while I had already walked away! SMH! I'm really disappointed with the service because I come here all the time and I do not wish to come back...

Some of the most delicious food I have EVER had! I am so glad we took the chance to check this place out this past weekend while in Vegas. I will definitely make it a point to come back here during my yearly trips to Vegas!

yes, it's the best greek food in town, but the addition of the server (instead of perfectly acceptable counter service) has turned us off to this otherwise very good restaurant.

I was also disappointed that they refuse to honor their entertainment coupon published in entertainment 2009.  No explanation, just that they apparently decided not to honor it.

Despite the food being good, these issues mean we won't be back.
Best darned Greek food I've ever eaten. I come back here for another gyro every time I return to Vegas. Hopefully they're around forever.

I love this place! I've been trying all if the amazing Greek food in this town but this place was soooo delicious. I had the Babaganoush app and the Moussaka for my entree. It was the best I've ever had! The people are super friendly and service was top notch. This restaurant has a very home style feel which I think makes the food taste even better! If you are looking for some tasty Greek food, head to this place. You won't be disappointed!!!
Best Greek food I've had in a long time!!! First time at this place and I will DEFINITELY be going back!
Greet food great customer service, Clean, the owners are very nice and try to do their best.  Highly recommended

My wife ordered the chicken souvlaki plate while I requested the gyro plate.  Each entrée included warm pita, a salad, rice pilaf and tzadsiki.  The chicken breast was juicy and my gyro meat was both ample and moist, but the side salad and pilaf were disappointing.  I tendered a 2/1 coupon from the Entertainment book, but we were told they stopped accepting the coupons in February, but would accept ours.

I was in the area with my friend and her daughter, so I figured it was a great opportunity to check out a new spot. Plus, I LOVE Greek food!

Falafel ($5.95): Appetizer version comes with four falafel, lettuce, tomato, pita bread, and tahini sauce. The falafel is DELICIOUS. The flavor and seasonings are so good, it almost makes me not want to eat meat (almost). I loved the tahini too.

Tzatziki ($5.55): A very generous portion of this popular Greek yogurt dip served with warm pita bread and small pita chips. I really enjoyed their version of tzatziki; perfect balance of flavors. Also, I thought it was so neat that you have options with soft, fluffy pita bread or crunchy pita chips. I preferred the bread with tzatziki, whereas the chips were fantastic with tahini.

Traditional Gyro ($8.99): Stuffed with the famous gyro meat, lettuce, tomato, red onion, and of course, tzatziki. Stuffed is a pretty accurate description since this sandwich is HUGE! It's also delicious. It's served with Greek Fries or Salad (I opted for the fries). The fries have a wonderful seasoning on them, but lacked in salt and flavor. Not a difficult problem to fix with a little help from table salt, however, they still rated rather low on my "Favorite Fries List."

My friend ordered the Chicken Gyro and fortunately, I tried their fantastic chicken! It's moist and very flavorful. Even the little one really enjoyed it. I rarely order chicken in Greek restaurants since I love gyro meat so much, but their chicken is convincing.

Service was great, too. The young gentleman assisting us was prompt with his service throughout our meal, accommodating, and very kind. He was so sweet with the baby!

The prices are a little higher here than at other Greek restaurants, but I'm not complaining.  I've only eaten at the Greek Bistro once, but they served me the best gyro I've ever had.  The fries were terrific.  Normally I don't like fries that much, but the seasoning that they put on them is incredible.  The service was friendly and the food came out fairly quickly.  I'd like to get back sometime soon to try something else on the menu.

I was hesitant to try this place out since it was so close to The Great Greek. The reviews are half what GG has but the stars came out to be about the same. It's a little slower paced here and not as prosperous as GG. Food wise, it is very tasty and cooked well. The service is very friendly. We ordered 3 traditional gyros and a chicken salad. Why 3 gyros? No one wanted to share theirs I guess, me included. The fries is crunchy and seasoned. There was no oily residue. The traditional gyro was made of lamb and beef that they ground into a pate meat. I was afraid it was prepackaged from Uncle Sam...Sam Walton that is (he of beat up pick-up for Wal-mart grand openings while family are each multibillionaire jetsetters fame). But the smarter half said that's how they make it, they put it through a grinder. You can see the kitchen from the counter so I suppose if you had no shame you can stand there and just watch them feed the machine. The dish came with a side of yogurt mayo kind of dressing which was perfect for the fries. I used both ketchup and the yogurt mix. The rest of my table preferred the yogurt only but I put ketchup on my fried chicken and rice sometimes so I slathered it in my fries of course. Relax, it's Heinz not Hunt's catsup. Overall, GG prob a tad better but this is not a bad alternative either. They have different dishes and both make their dishes well. The chicken salad was well made, seasoned grilled chicken, plenty of romaine lettuce (I think) and some tart olives to keep you awake in case you got a case of food coma. Prices are about the same as GG. We went in at about 5:30ish so there were plenty of tables, come 6pm, most of the tables were filled. One chicken salad, 3 gyros, and 2 beers came out to be around $44. I think the salad was about ~$10.95 and the gyros at ~$8.95.

Being a block away from each other maybe they know each other or are related? They had a cute/weird phrase above the counter...."the heart of Greece lies in its food every bite is like a kiss." It might be one of the few times where I got lucky and didn't know about it. If I knew earlier, I would've brought my Chapstick.

We stumbled upon this quaint, family owned restaurant during our short stay in Henderson, NV. My husband and I are foodies and health nuts who avoid chains at all cost. This place is a hidden gem that gives an appetizing taste of both Greek culture and flavor. We decided it was definitely one we would re-visit if we lived nearby.

The service was fast and friendly. Gyro Salad was huge and topped with a mound of very flavorful meat. Ask for tzatziki sauce on the side because they give you a large portion. Warm pita bread was also a delicious compliment to the meal...very good with the tzatziki sauce or hummus dip.

I LOVE this place!  From start to finish, this has become one of my most favorite restaurants in town. 

The family who owns the business are all so nice and helpful, and very, very welcoming.  The food is to die for as well- my favorite is their Shrimp a la Greek and my husband is hooked on their lamb shank.  Fresh Mediterranean salads on the side, and a sinfully delicious baklava to finish it all up... we leave full and smiling each and every visit.  You will too!

Hands down the most authentic am great tasting gyro I have had amazing flavor down the fries , everything is literally so good!! I highly recommend this place. I'm a good guy I have excellent taste I promise you, YOU CAN TAKE MY WORD, TRUST IN MY REVIEWS.. the salads are amazing the grape leaf rolls are great the pita the tiziki everything is so good and i enjoyed the Greek ambiance the restaurant has to offer. MUST HAVE IF YOUR IN HENDERSON. If not it's worth the drive...

I have been coming here for years. The food and service are always amazing. They always make me feel like a welcomed guest in their home. It's refreshing to find a quality, family owned business in Vegas. I highly recommend!

Just about 20 minutes after eating here my stomach hurts and I ate it yesterday and I've had stomach problems since YESTERDAY after eating here. 
I eat out a lot. I've never had a sensitive tummy. I can eat spicy food. I can eat just about anything and never get an upset tummy so it worries me that since yesterday after eating here I've been in pain. 
It has to be something pretty gross to have me feeling this way into the NEXT day?
Love this place. The food is amazing and the owners are truly wonderful people. As long as they are there we won't go anywhere else!!!!
Chicken gyro and fries I love it. Great spot for lunch or dinner. Nice people good service. Eat in or call in for pick on the way home. Either way try it out. Yum
I love this place. My boyfriend and I go whenever we can. The food is always great and the service is great too. Highly recommend if you like good Greek food!
Had the beef gyro--it was pretty good and was a large size. Not a fan of the fries. Baklava was possibly the worst I have ever had--tasted very old or burnt.

After reading all the great reviews on Yelp I decided to give it a try especially since I would be shopping at Walmart and Lowe's just a very short distance away.
All the positive prior reviews were are absolutely correct. For a smaller establishment the seating is very amble as is the parking. For my first foray I decided to go with the classic gyro with side salad instead of fries. The gryo was so packed with quality meat that it was difficult to do justice to my salad. Next time I'll have them pack the salad to go. After all I needed to save room for dessert... so I decided to order the baklava. Without a doubt world class....5 stars. The Greek Bistro it's going to be one of my favorite local restaurants.

Started with the Hummus. It was amazing! Some of the best hummus I've ever had! Ate all of it. Then I had the Traditional Gyro with Greek fries. Delicious! Boyfriend had the Gyro Plate and he loved it. Great place, great food. We will definitely be going back soon!

The Greek bistro is the perfect bang for your buck, the food, customer service, and amazing atmosphere with friendly faces. Greek Bistro's is a amazing restaurant with a focus on taste and food presentation, I haven't tried all the food options yet but I feel that the gyro and kabob is second to none with a colorful and tasty palette all at a affordable price and getting you filled right up every time. I've been coming to this restaurant 1-2 every other week , always meeting the same friendly faces every time I show up.  I would give a 6/5 if I can :)

I came to this place looking for some good Greek but ended up finding the best koobideh/ground beef kabob in Vegas. Skip the expensive and always disappointing Persian restaurants. This is one of the best kabobs I've had and that's saying a lot since I'm Middle Eastern. Two huge kabobs and rice for only $13!! Cannot be beat.

Gyros here are so good! Flavorful and delicious. 
I love their Greek fries!!! They add tons of flavors to it- amazing!

Best greek so far in Henderson !! Service always great.  Gyros, fries, avolemongo, pastistio, lamb shank, greek salads, i.e. everything on the menu... all done the right way!!!! We're regulars, never ever disappoints!!

Excellent little Greek cafe hidden in a small strip mall next to Sunset Station. I love their Gyros and tiropita. The service is good and the prices are reasonable. Try the Greek fries with seasoning and feta cheese, wonderful. The portion sizes are fair for the price.

I love everything at the Greek Bistro but my favorite are the Gyro wrap (the meet is sooo fresh) and feta fries!!!!!!!!!!! I am from LA but when I go to Vegas my first stop is always at the Greek Bistro. Amazing food and best service. 

P.s.  I give 5 stars for the cleanness of the place, 5 stars for service, and 5 stars for the food!!!!

Saw this place on Yelp when I was in Henderson and figured I would give it a try for lunch.  It was located in a stripmall and was a little ...old looking.  I went in and the place was clean and the staff was really friendly.  I figured I would just try the plain gyro with a salad instead of fries, when it came out I was pretty surprised how big o a portion it was.  Everything about it was great, the gyro was one of the best I have had and the side salad was worht getting on its own.

Came highly recommended by a friend and we were not disappointed! Had the traditional gyro with fries very flavorful! My sister had the chicken gyro with fries and she loved it. Their fries are bomb dot com!! The staff/owners super friendly and attentive. Oh try their lemonade it was really good and I don't really like lemonade unless it has alcohol. Definitely will be back.
Still the best Greek food in Henderson.  Chicken Gyro sandwich is my favorite and French fries are amazing.  I tried everything on the menu.  Delicious!!!
Food was all very good. You can tell this is a family owned establishment. Very delicious
Found this on yelp and we were not disappointed. Generous servings, food reached us pipping hot. Love the hot sauce. Definitely will come back again!!

Excellent local find. Service was excellent along with the food. Falafel gyro and the traditional gyro were outstanding, and their rice pudding desert is by far the best rice pudding I've ever had. Being a lover of Greek food, as well as having traveled to Greece, this is easily some of the best Greek food I've had.

This place has THE BEST Greek food I've ever had! The best tzatziki ever! The pita chips and bread are delicious. The traditional gyro is great - in part because do the tzatziki and pita bread! Been here twice and the staff is great. Can't wait to go back!

Found this place on Christmas Eve since every place we originally planned on eating closed shortly after lunch. My boyfriend and I were pleased we stumbled upon this Greek Bistro since we acquired a taste for Greek back in Reno. We were quite sad we'd be leaving the family owned place since we ate there often, but were hopeful when we enjoyed the dishes here. This will definitely be our go to when we get a craving. We tried the falafel appetizer, delicious, and the
keftedakia kabob, also delicious! The service was also a pleasant experience. Can't wait to go back and try their Gyro.

I absolutely love Greek food and this is by far the best I've had in town. Gyro is amazing, both the chicken and the beef! But the absolute winner is their Pasticcio. I have to say it is one of the only dishes in town that I will drive thirty minutes for (about how long it takes for me to get from my apt to the restaurant). The noodles are long and thin, it is well seasoned and there is just enough sauce and ground beef inside; and the top is browned, ahhh I'm salivating just thinking about it. Pasticcio is sometimes called a Greek Lasagna, but I have never had Lasagna this good!! My dad lives around the corner and he was the first person to introduce me to Greek Bistro. My dad is a fantastic chef so my idea of good food has always been a little higher. Before coming to Greek Bistro I had Pasticcio at the Greek Festival held in town every year and was soooo disappointed because I always loved my dad's Pasticcio growing up. But if his was ten times better than their's, Greek Bistro's is ten times better than his. Sorry Dad!! Thank you Greek Bistro for loving my taste buds!

Greek food usually isn't my thing, but I started to come here for the past 2 years on and off since one of my offices is next door to them.  The food is authentic, and the service is down right homely.  They make you feel like you're apart of the family.  You'll find all the usual suspects like Gyros, Greek chicken salads, lamb, ect.   The filet meal is always my go to... can't go wrong for $15.

Quaint family run business.  Murals of Greece on the walls.  Large portions.  The woman owner is very sweet and gives great service.  The steak kabobs are delicious and tender.  Good salads, taziki, hummus and spanokopita.  They also serve beer and wine.  Casual and delicious.

The lemon potatoes are like crack! I don't know what they season them with, but they are SO good! I got a gyro plate and it was all very yummy. Great tzatziki sauce! I also got dolmades - delish! Can't complain at all - this place rocks. :) The customer service was wonderful too; the lady made sure I had everything I needed when I picked it up. I'll definitely be back!

Love their gyro sandwich....Lots of meat and tasted delish! Authentic Taste! Price is reasonable... Hope they don't check change the meat portion. And of, the lady greeted us as soon as we walked in. There is nothing much nicer being welcome with a smile.  That  such quality in food places sometimes lacks.

A group of us went here on our lunch break. There were quite a number of empty tables. We all got the same stuff: gyro with fries. I also placed a to-go order for another co-worker with our dine-in order. The server asked, "do you want it immediately?" Well, yes, that's the whole point of ordering it with everything else.

The food was great. The pita was warm, fresh and soft. The fries were tasty and crunchy. But where's my to-go order?

We had to follow-up many times with 3 different people. "I didn't think you wanted it now." WTH??? No apologies whatsoever. We were very late for our meeting and a co-worker starved to death. Don't go here on your lunch break!

Great Greek place right by Sunset Station and across the street from the Galleria. This is also not far from my work. I love the service, the decor, the ambiance and the food in this little slice of Greece! From the first moment of walking in, you can tell this is a small, family owned GREEK restaurant. The decor is tastefully done in all blue and white (Greek flag colors), the blue is especially nice and calming.  You can also see pictures of the owner's family and Greece all around. You can take to go or dine in, your choice. Either way, the service is thoughtful, quick and efficient. My co-worker was there fore the first time and never had Greek food before. The servers all spoke English and explained pretty much every single dish very effectively. Very impressive for an ethnic restaurant especially.

I like their vegetarian menu. Veggie Alexander and salads are excellent. I have yet to hear someone complain about their gyros. Nothing is microwaved here, but cooked right in front of your eyes. The ingredients look and taste very fresh. 

This is one little Greek place, unassuming and unboastfull, but serves good, quality food in little time.

One little quip, they discontinued their veggie gyro, which was excellent and my favorite thing on the menu...oh well..this place is still great and highly recommended by me.
We ordered the traditional gyro, one with fries and the other with salad. The portion was large and it was good. Staff was friendly and the place was clean. I would definitely go back.
Food & service are great! Feels like you're having dinner @ the home of greek friends (price is very reasonable too!)

Awesome family-owned Greek place! The food was delicious. One of my favorite things to eat is hummus and their's was fantastic. I loved the pita chips - nice touch. Came with friends and the employees were all so sweet to us and both of our infants. Greek salad with chicken comes with so much chicken - great portions. We were served quickly and they were great about staying on top of our drinks. Will be back!

I've been coming here since 2006 , The food is great. It's under a new management they taken the Greek feel away and replace the furniture with old plywood tables & chairs that carry a smell:(. Which is why I haven't return. Which is unfortunate since it was my favorite place to eat. This is why they got a 3 star.

We had a work lunch catered through Greek Bistro today and it was fantastic, I had eaten here one time previously for lunch take out and remember it was good but I wasn't hurrying back. I'm not a super huge fan of Greek food but this was really tasty! I would recommend it to anyone looking for Greek food in the area.
We had a little bit of everything...Salad, Gyro meat, Chicken, Pita Bread, Lemon Potatoes, Seasoned French Fries, Falafel, and Rice and all the sauces. The meat and chicken was moist and flavorful. Somehow they are able to keep their fries from getting soggy during transport! The Falafel was a bit dry and may have been a bit over cooked, a little dark on the outside. Everyone loved just about every thing, it was a big hit with us!
I will give them another try on my own and hopefully get to use them through work again.

Great gyros and very friendly service! Stopped in this past weekend for lunch with the family. The staff was great with our 2 young boys, got our food to us fast and we were all very happy when we left.

Great quality gyro meat, the fries were yummy and my only small complaint was it was a bit on the warm side for us. We'll definitely be back.

Hey Family!! I absolutelyyyyy looooove this bistro!! The food is so fresh and clean, the building is always tidy, and the customer service is top notch!! They know my order by heart.  Living in Texas and San Diego for the Navy... This is the best Greek I have ever had. Indulge!!
So I've had some more greek restaurant experiences, and this place's gyros and tzadziki can't be beat! Not to mention we never have to ask for anything, our service is always perfect.

This place was awesome!  We had the traditional gyro with fries. Delicious!!  The meat was so moist and tender and tasty! And it was a lot!  Everything was fresh and plentiful!  And for dessert we had the rice pudding. Delicious!  If you are looking for some Mediterranean food this is the place for you!
This is my favorite place to get a gyro. Always delicious and the fry seasoning is amazing. Super friendly and clean.

Been here a few times food is great and delicious 
Staff is friendly 
Fresh and super flavourful

the food and service was amazing. one of my new favorite spots! I highly recommend the chicken gyro, it's delicious. the chicken gyro usually comes with fries but I got Greek rice instead. the rice was excellent as well. I will definitely be coming back!
Great place nice experience. The servers are nice and the owners are awesome. Keep up the good work greek bistro. I will be back!!!

We came in for the first time today at about 2:30 on a Saturday. The place was empty. By 3:00, almost every table was taken, which seemed strange. My wife and I enjoyed the chicken souvlaki which came with a salad first. The salad was very good. Then came the grilled chicken which looked to be marinated in a sauce similar in color and taste to our salad dressing, with onions and grilled tomatoes, and we opted for the rice pilaf. A small plastic tub came on the side with tzatziki sauce, which was maybe the best I've ever had in my life. The owner came over to pick up my plate and I remarked how great the food was and that the true mark of great Greek food for me is the tzatziki sauce. Her response was, "We have the best tzatziki sauce in the world!" I'm coming back to try the lamb and I'm getting extra tzatziki!!!

After driving past here literally 500 times over the past several years, I finally stopped by. Usually I go to another Greek restaurant a little South of here..

Gotta say, one of the Top 2 or 3 grilled chicken kabob/sandwich/pitas I've ever had. A LOT of meat. Most places when you're half way through the pita sandwich, you realize they shoved all the meat at the open end, to look "full," only to leave you with veggies and sauce in the last half. Not this place. Very full and tasty!

The side salad was a good size and tasted like a typical Greek salad. I hate olives, but if I liked em, I might've been bothered by only getting one in my salad. "Fresh" is an overrated word when it comes to describing food, but this place deserves it.

I don't see why others say this isn't as authentic a atmosphere as other Greek restaurants. I don't give a crap who works here, as long as the food is great.. but I know several people that won't eat at certain places unless the people making it are of the same ethnicity as the food. For example, my mom won't eat Mexican food unless it's Mexicans making the food. Sushi Twister north of here even uses this to it's advantage with their slogan: "Japanese owned and operated." My point is everyone from the Mexican lady that made my food to the Asian lady that took my order would not defer me from a "authentic Greek experience." Haha, get over it, and just enjoy the food.

My review will turn into a 5 star with a couple more near perfect visits. Great job, and great food so far!

This place is the bizomb!!!! Was going to another Greek restaurant in the area, but got there and discovered they closed down. Thanks God because otherwise I wouldn't have found the Greek Bistro.

I've eaten tons if gyros before (if you don't believe me just check out my FB profile for proof of my waistline) and this one stacks up among the best. Super fresh, great tzatziki, great flat bread & lots of moist & juicy lamb. Can you say nomnom?!? I can't because my mouth is full of gyro, yo!!!  

A little on the pricey side at $10.81 for gyro, fries & drink, but def worth it. The gyro is huge & lots of Greek fries (BTW, the fries are awesome too).  Definitely coming back to this place.  He'll, I would scale Mt. Olympus to get back to this place.  I'll be dreaming in Greek tonight - no doubt!

Delicious family run Greek restaurant; definitely one of the best in Henderson. I am a big fan of their Gyros and I appreciate the ripe tomatoes, house made sauce, and plentiful Gyro meat. My problem is that I like Gyros so much that it is hard for me to try anything else, Lol. Therefore I cannot review the other items on the menu, but their french fries have a unique seasoning blend that is a nice touch.
The server was genuinely friendly and his service was excellent.  The ambiance is nice and I love the wallpaper with views of the Greek Islands. I will be back next time I am in the area and have a Gyro craving!

Love the gyros here. The lamb is cooked perfectly. Everything is fresh. The fries are uniquely seasoned and I eat too many every time! There's a great pastry dessert with fruit, goes really well with their strong Turkish coffee. Got 2 platters of baklava for a party once and it was a big hit.

Update Time

GB is still a great spot to get your Greek food fix in Henderson.  I've been back for lunch multiple times since the first time I reviewed this place, usually for the chicken gyro and fries.  Today I finally switched it up, trying the avgolemono (egg-lemon) soup after some Yelp friends were talking it up yesterday.  Definitely lemony, this chicken soup with rice was a delightful accompaniment to the chicken salad, another first for me there.  Both are served with soft pieces of pita bread and it made for a delicious meal.  I took half of the salad to go since it's a generous portion and I was already a bit full with the soup.  This family-run business always has great service and I'm never disappointed with a meal there.

UN-BELIEVABLE!!!  It's like fresh out of Mama Greece's kitchen! Service is outstanding; warm & friendly. And the food? I'm not sure there are words in the English language to describe how amazingly delicious this was!!!! Can't wait to come back! :) Thank you!

My boyfriend and I enjoy coming here frequently.
The staff are all very friendly and the food is awesome

The food here is amazing.  I have been going here for two years now.  The Greek soup is super good. Their salads are fresh.  The Gyros are also delicious and not greasy.  The restaurant is smaller in size so at lunch time they are packed but make every effort to get tables busted and people seated as quickly as possible. This is my go to Greek food restaurant.

I adore this place, the food is always fresh and delicious, it's well-spiced, but light as well. I've had their salads, gyro, and souvlaki, all excellent. The meat is juicy and well-marinated. Don't leave without a slice of their galactobureko, which is filo with sweet custard. Usually by the time we leave, we're too full to eat dessert so we take some home for later. It's to die for. The service is also excellent. We've only gone in a handful of times, but the server always remembers us and is very friendly. Don't pass up a chance to try this place.
This is one of the best Greek restaurants in town. Gyros are on point, lemon potatoes are a signature item, best spanikopita! Clean hole-in-the-wall with a mom and pop vibe and great service.

Was headed to my fav spot The Great Greek just up the street when I came across this spot and decided to give it a try and see how it measured up. I ordered the soup and chicken gyro that came with salad or fries. I opt for the salad. The soup was amazing, the gyro although tasty I wasn't a fan of the tzadziki, I felt the chicken was a little on chewy side. The older woman who works here seemed to be more occupied with other patrons and showing them pictures on her phone which left me sitting waiting for my check with an empty glass of water for a good 15-20 mins. For me personally I will stick to my fav spot. This is not a bad alternative and a bit more $.

So...I almost didn't want to share this review because I don't want this place to become too known. Haha hidden treasures are the best. However, the food is so great the owners deserve more people to know about them. I worked at a Greek restaurant with a much larger menu for a significant amount of time and this place blows them out of the water. 

The chicken is so moist and flavorful, the salad is absolutely delicious with the perfect about of dressing and ingredients. They're not skimpy at all, the load the gyros with meat. The hummus is delicious also, sometimes hummus can be too grainy which can ruin the flavor, definitely not the case here.

Service is quick and efficient. The inside of the restaurant is alright, you can definitely see what they're trying to get across. The atmosphere I'm not completely in love with, but then again they don't have much space to work with. I'll keep going back because it's delicious, healthy, a great deal, and close to work. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

This place is such an incredible, family owned restaurant!  I am so happy that we finally stopped in for lunch recently.

I was nearby at Costco, filling up my tank, and was starving. I thought Greek food sounded yummy, and I knew this place was close, so we decided to try it.

First of all, it's really cute. I love the décor, with the blue chairs and the mural of Greece on the wall.

We entered the restaurant and were immediately greeted by a nice young guy at the counter. When we said we were eating in, he said we could sit anywhere we'd like, and he brought us menus.

We decided to share hummus to start.  It was really tasty and served with fresh pita bread, as well as pita chips.  I think the chips may have been baked and they were really the highlight - they were SO good!

Then we shared the gyro plate, even though I wasn't sure it would be enough food.  Boy was I wrong! It was more than enough for 2 hungry people and it was so delicious.  The meat was some of the tastiest I have ever had, the tzatziki was fresh and the salad was huge! 

The service was pretty much invisible, which is totally OK. I don't need a lot of attention to enjoy my meal.  It's a family owned place, and everyone was very friendly.

We really enjoyed our meal and are looking forward to going back again soon.
Gluten Free? I get the feta fries, the rice bowl with chicken, and their yummy rice pudding. I eat here at least 1-2 a week. Love it.

We've been here dozens of times. This place gets fast full during lunch, as well as dinner. Be prepared to say hello to friendly tourists. Inconspicuously located just east of the Sunset Station Casino Hotel, you will be welcomed by very pleasant Greek Orthodox owners who migrated from Persia to Armenia. Their friendly son serves at Lunch Time. At dinner time, meet the husband and wife owners who show their care for providing excellent service in a "mom and pop" environment. We both ordered Gyros Sandwiches. Mary ordered the NO SALT Fries while I brazenly ordered the very tasty salted herb chili fries with tzatsizi yogurt/cucumber sauce (which made me happy but later in the evening raised my blood pressure in the evening).  UNDOUBTEDLY this place reminds us of our go to Gyros stop back in Munich, Germany and is by far the best place for Gyros in Henderson. Compared to the other smoky places, we keep coming back here after our shopping at the nearby Costco, TJ Maxx and other fashion stores around.
Love this little hidden gem. Best gyro by far in this town.

Not quite a 5-star gyro but it was still pretty good. There could have been a little more meat in the sandwich, but it did include greek fries or a salad with the meal- I got the fries and they were delicious. I would go here over The Great Greek mostly due to the price. The sandwiches were pretty comparable, but for the same price I got fries included here.
Probably the best Greek spot I have ever had hands down and the family that owns it is the nicest ever. Gyros and spanakopita is a must and they're baklava omg!!!

The food was great and so was the service!! Another one of my favorites because it is FAMILY owned and operated!! Our server was the son and he was funny, sweet and efficient. I would highly recommend from the vegetarian part of the menu, the vegetable (pastry) Not sure of the exact name. I have never experienced a greater Greek meal.

I was thinking about going to the Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace today but I've been there so many times and I wanted to try something new. So I found the Greek Bistro on Yelp and I came battle hungry haven't ate breakfast or lunch yet. So I ordered the chicken gyro and the grilled beef plate along with some fries. The server was nice and friendly and got my ice tea filled every time it was empty. Now down to the food 

Chicken gyro 4/5 the portion was spot on and nice grilled chicken

Greek salad 3/5 it was bland I want more sour and tangy flavor

Grilled Beef plate 4/5 the rice was not bad and the grilled beef was right on

Ice tea 4/5 nice taste and I got my refilled every time

Fries 4/5 nice and crispy and hugh portions 

I don't know how is this place surviving because they're zillions of good eateries around that area and when I went around 2PM there were only 2 people and myself.

Best Gyros in town.. !!!! My friend recommended this place.. I luv this place..easy to park and big dining room to eat in as well. I eat here at least once a week.. Call ahead the order to go and not once have They have not gotten my order wrong.. I am picky..

Used to go to the one on Warm Springs.. Yelled at one too many times from the employees.. And Way too small & the wait for to go takes forever..I luv gyros but not worth the size of this restaurant and the rudeness of the staff..

The best Greek food around! You can tell that the manager and the other employees incorporate traditional recipes to make their food delicious, unique, and authentic. I loved the chicken gyro. The vegetables and chicken were cooked perfectly, and the fries, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce had outstanding flavor. The service was fast and accurate, the manager was very nice, the employees were attentive, and the restaurant was nicely decorated and clean. Will definitely be visiting again.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to come to when I'm in Las Vegas. The staff and owner are friendly, and the food is absolutely wonderful!  I dined there on March 15, 2014 with my two dining companions.  Two of us had souvlaki - he the chicken, me the steak - and both were perfect.  I had a bite of his chicken and it was perfectly marinated and seasoned - ditto with the steak.  Their meat marinade must be a well-kept secret, it is SO good!  Our third diner had the gyros plate, which was equally good.  The salad accompaniment is fresh and perfect to go with the food. The lemon potatoes are a must-have and are fabulous.  All in all, I can find no fault with this lovely little piece of Greece in the middle of a small strip mall.  Incidentally, they are very friendly to their patrons in wheelchairs, of which two arrived while we were there. Hospitality and excellent food abound. You won't be disappointed!

Wonderful family run greek restaurant. It's a little hard to find but you will be glad you did! They have the best gyros and baklava I have ever had, including from Greece. 

The gyros are on super soft pita bread with plenty of taziki  sauce and even an extra side for those of us who love taziki. The meat is delicious, very tender and topped with diced tomato and cucumber. They also have a gyro salad it you are watching your carbs :). It comes with either a greek salad or fries. The fries are seasoned and make a perfect match. 

Don't leave without trying the baklava. It is so flaky and full of nuts and honey, absolutely delicious.
Hand down BEST GREEK FOOD IN TOWN!! I love this place every time I go in there they are so friendly very authentic place love love love

So the first good Greek food experience I had in Vegas was actually at The Fat Greek off of Decatur. This place BEATS that hands down!!! 

It's a small hole in the wall, mom & pop type of place. It has really basic decor (yet a flat screen TV), but plenty of seating and exceptional food. I mean, wouldn't you rather go to a place that isn't visually extraordinary, but has amazing food?

The service was great. They were very nice and accommodating. There were only two servers, one of which I believe was the owner (the 'mom' part of mom & pop), but kept up with the demand of 6 or 7 tables of people.

My mom and I ordered an appetizer of lebneh, which I am SO happy they had, and dolmas (stuffed grape leaves). The lebneh is a kind of strained yogurt, just slightly thinner in consistency than cream cheese and is reminiscent of sour cream. It came out with warm, fresh pita, which is some of the best I've had. It was nice and soft with a wonderful flavor you would expect from fresh bread.

For the main course we both ordered gyros. I mean, you have to order gyros your first time at any Greek place right? She ordered the traditional lamb/beef gyro with a side Greek salad and I ordered a chicken gyro, since I don't eat red meat, with fries. My mom's not very good at description, but told me that her gyro was one of the best she's had...and that's saying a lot seeing as she's been around for awhile - haha. The salad was a basic Greek, but had tons of flavor and the Greek dressing was tasty.

The chicken gyro was DELICIOUS! The chicken was sliced very thin, like you would expect from a traditional gyro, which I appreciated. (When I've ordered a chicken gyro elsewhere they tend to serve it kebob style, which doesn't make for easy eating.) It was very tender and juicy with good seasoning. It was served on that warm, fresh pita with lettuce, tomato, thinly sliced red onion, and gyro sauce. The only bad thing I can say is that they put  A LOT of onion on the gyro...so watch out who you engage in close face to face conversation with later in the day. Mine was served with a side of french fries with a Greek seasoning sprinkled on top...they were SO good. They were nice and hot with the crunchy outside and very soft middle. I couldn't stop eating them, despite my fullness. My mouth kept telling me "one more" while my stomach was telling me "please make it stop." Yet, I couldn't stop...especially when those hot tasty fries were dipped in tzatziki. Speaking of, their tzatziki was really good too. It had good flavor and was a nice consistency. It's hard to make a tzatziki that isn't bland and watery, but they accomplished it well.

The pricing is fair too, especially for the amount of food you get. I think we spent a grand total of 30 something dollars for two appetizers and two entrees.

The only thing I really wish they had was an appetizer sampler. They had so many good appetizers (hummus, labneh, dolmas, etc) and I wanted to try them all...but alas...I couldn't. A sampler would be perfect for anybody wanting to try a little bit of everything, but still have enough room to order an entree!! (hint, hint)

I absolutely love this place, and despite the fact that it's hella far from my house, I will definitely frequent here again...and again.

I am from NYC but as soon as I tasted the homemade grape leaves decided I want to move here!!

Everything is delicious and fresh. You can't go wrong.

I love the food here.  Pita is fresh, hummus is
honemade, family owned.  People who take pride in what they serve.  If you are looking for atmosphere this place is prett austere, if it is about the food, this is the place!
